snippet: The latest New York Times/CBS News poll comes as the Supreme Court prepares to issue decisions on two high-profile gay marriage cases.
abstract: New York Times/CBS News poll finds that solid majority of Americans oppose broad national right to same-sex marriage, saying power to legalize gay unions should rest with states, even as most support marriage equality for gay people; survey comes as the Supreme Court prepares to issue decisions on two high-profile gay marriage cases; other poll findings discussed.

byline.original: By SHERYL GAY STOLBERG and DALIA SUSSMAN
byline.contributor: Megan Thee-Brenan and Allison Kopicki contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The latest New York Times/CBS News poll comes as the Supreme Court prepares to issue decisions on two high-profile gay marriage cases.

headline.seo: States Should Decide Gay Marriage, Poll Finds
headline.main: Same-Sex Marriage Is Seen in Poll as an Issue for the States
headline.print_headline: Gay Marriage Seen in Poll as Issue for the States

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
